definitions: Past tense of smoke; to inhale and exhale the smoke of tobacco or similar substances.
Past tense of smoke; to cure or preserve (food, especially meat or fish) by exposure to smoke.
Past tense of smoke; to drive out or away by means of smoke.
Past tense of smoke; to subject to smoke for disinfection or pest control.
Past tense of smoke; to consume (something) by smoking it.
Past tense of smoke; to produce or emit smoke.
Past tense of smoke; to move or go very fast.
examples: He smoked a cigarette after dinner.
The salmon was smoked to perfection.
They smoked the bees out of the hive.
The car smoked down the highway.
